comments:
I have java project with some xml files in one of the source directories and these xml files have DTD validation markers (I happen to have WTP installed too). I get the following exceptions each time I rebuild this project. 

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.mylar.java.JavaProblemListener.problemsChanged(JavaProblemListener.java:40)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.ProblemMarkerManager$1.run(ProblemMarkerManager.java:176)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runAsyncMessages(Display.java:3057)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2716)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runEventLoop(Workbench.java:1699)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.runUI(Workbench.java:1663)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.createAndRunWorkbench(Workbench.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.ui.PlatformUI.createAndRunWorkbench(PlatformUI.java:143)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ide.IDEApplication.run(IDEApplication.java:103)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:226)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:376)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:163)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:64)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:615)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

Mylar 0.4.3, Eclipse 3.1.1. I will attach trivial patch shortly.

Created an attachment (id=30453)
proposed fix

Proposed solution is to ignore all non-java resources.

Thanks for the patch Igor!  I've applied it, and just made the small change of turning the continue into an "if".  I usually prefer to avoid break and continue statemetns, but sometimes wonder if the additional nesting is worse in the end...

Btw, I'm still finding that having the problems option results in too much Package Explorer refresh and keeping it off (hence it's off by default).  That might improve for 0.4.4.

One more thing: regarding the errors in other resources, there is some infrastructure for making those get a predicted interest (ResourceMarkerListener in mylar.ide), but it's currently disabled.  If it's something you would like to see the corresponding report is bug 103283.
